title: Ticket #7064: Make queue_with_itemdata easier to user
description:
The queue_with_itemdata method has the right approach but there are two big annoyances:

  1. The keyword argument from is literally impossible to use as this is a reserved keyword. This should be renamed to data.
  2. The from (data) keyword argument should accept iterables in addition to iterators.
remarks:
2019-May-22 12:00:58 by bbockelm:
Other items:

  1. We decided to use itemdata instead of data for the keyword.
  2. We should cast values in the itemdata to string.

2019-May-22 13:18:29 by bbockelm:
PR posted: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/pull/43

2019-Aug-05 15:24:55 by karpel:
This is currently broken on 8.9.3

If you pass in None for the itemdata, as either the default or explicitly, this change tries to turn it into an iterator, which obviously fails. See example below. Both calls work as expected on 8.9.2. 

In [1]: import htcondor

In [2]: s = htcondor.Submit(executable = '/bin/sleep', arguments = '1m')

In [3]: s
Out[3]: 'executable = /bin/sleep\narguments = 1m\n'

In [4]: print(s)
executable = /bin/sleep
arguments = 1m


In [5]: schedd = htcondor.Schedd()

In [7]: with schedd.transaction() as txn:
   ...:     s.queue_with_itemdata(txn, 5, None)
   ...:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-7-f13df81dd280> in <module>
      1 with schedd.transaction() as txn:
----> 2     s.queue_with_itemdata(txn, 5, None)
      3

TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable

In [8]: with schedd.transaction() as txn:
   ...:     s.queue_with_itemdata(txn, 5)
   ...:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-8-c06e7ce7970a> in <module>
      1 with schedd.transaction() as txn:
----> 2     s.queue_with_itemdata(txn, 5)
      3

TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable

2019-Aug-05 22:49:29 by bbockelm:
Ok, fixed in [57600]

Josh, can you please re-test and confirm the regression is fixed?

2019-Aug-05 22:52:11 by karpel:
I can test it manually, but I'd prefer something that actually checks this function in the test suite.

2019-Aug-05 23:04:08 by bbockelm:
  I can test it manually, but I'd prefer something that actually checks this function in the test suite.

Certainly!

However, in the spirit of "first one, then the other", can you verify your manual test work, then file a follow-up ticket on doing the tests? I don't want to add too much stuff to a ticket this late in the 8.9.3 release process.

2019-Aug-06 11:20:08 by karpel:
I tested this locally and it works. Will make a ticket for the test.

2019-Sep-16 21:50:26 by tim:
We have reverted part of the commits for this ticket. We retained renaming "from" to "itemdata". The change to accept Iterables introduced regressions and will be addressed in a follow on ticket.
